rows.VA DAILY UPDATE — PRODUCTION SPEC: THE VA IS THE PRODUCT
The VA is not an admin person who also happens to update a website.
The VA IS the product. Their daily video IS the site's primary content.
If the video is bad, the site is bad. If the VA is boring, the site is boring.
The VA must be:
• Attractive (camera presence, not necessarily model — just someone you want to watch)
• Articulate (can explain what's happening in plain language, no jargon)
• Consistent (posts every single day, no exceptions, even if update is 'nothing happened today')
• Authentic (not reading a script, not corporate, real energy, real personality)
• Cinematic quality (good lighting, good audio, clean background, shot intentionally)
This is not a Loom recording in a messy bedroom.
This is produced content that happens to be real.
DAILY VIDEO FORMAT
Length: 60-90 seconds. Never longer. Tight.
Structure (every day):
1. DAY NUMBER — 'Day 7 of IonWave.'
2. HEADLINE — One sentence on the biggest thing that happened. 'Today we signed our CoS.'
3. THE DETAIL — 30 seconds of context. What happened, why it matters, what it means.
4. WHAT'S NEXT — 'Tomorrow we're doing X.'
5. SIGN OFF — Consistent outro. Brand moment.
Production requirements:
• 4K camera (iPhone 15 Pro is fine, doesn't need to be a RED)
• Ring light or natural lighting setup (consistent look every day)
• Lapel mic or shotgun mic (audio > video quality in importance)
• Same background every day OR rotating locations that feel intentional
• Color graded (even a simple LUT applied in post — takes 2 min)
• Subtle branded lower third (Day X / IonWave / role title)
Total daily production time: 15-20 minutes (shoot + basic edit + upload).
This is part of the VA's daily workflow, not a separate project.
MILESTONE VIDEOS (SPECIAL EPISODES)
On milestone days, the VA does a longer piece (3-5 min):
• 'We hired our first expert' — interview format, both on camera
• 'Entity is live' — show the documents, explain the structure
• 'First product sample arrived' — unboxing, reaction, real
• 'Met with our first investor' — debrief, what they asked, what we learned
• 'CoS joins the cast' — introduce them, their background, why they said yes
These are the episodes that get shared. The daily updates keep people engaged.
The milestone videos are what get forwarded to investors and recruits.
